Recharge address and tag are needed when you top up. Tag is the numeric string to ensure the uniqueness of your recharge address, which appears in pairs with recharge address and matches it in one-to-one correspondence. Please be sure to follow the correct recharge steps and enter complete information while withdrawing tokens, otherwise it may cause loss of tokens.
Name and real name authentication information are inconsistent

Index Price: The price of the underlying asset.\n Mark Price: This is the current mark price. \n This indicator shows your position in the auto-deleverage queue. If all lights are lit, in the event of a liquidation, your position may be reduced.
If the mark price of the contract reaches below this price (when long) or above this price (when short), your position will be liquidated.
The cost (in margin) to execute this order. This includes your selected leverage and your current position, if any. Reducing a position does not cost margin.

The latest mark price for this contract. This is the price used for PNL and margin calculations, and may differ from the last price for the purposes of avoiding price manipulation. This does not affect settlement.

The amount of margin locked by each position. If you have isolated margin on a position, this number will go down as the margin remaining decreases, and your effective leverage rises. Drag the leverage slider in the sidebar to adjust the margin assigned to your position.
Click to close your entire XBTUSD position at market.

Index Price: The price of the underlying asset.\n Mark Price: This is the current mark price.\nThis indicator shows your position in the auto-deleverage queue. If all lights are lit, in the event of a liquidation, your position may be reduced.
Order Margin: The minimum equity you must retain with the exchange to keep your open orders. This is the value of all open orders you have divided by the selected leverage.

Position Margin: The minimum equity you must retain with the exchange to keep your positions. This is the entry value of all contracts you hold divided by the selected leverage, plus unrealised profit and loss.
Unrealised PNL: Current profit and loss from all open positions.
Your margin available for new positions. Available Balance = (Margin Balance - Order Margin - Position Margin).
Account equity: Your total equity held with the exchange. Margin Balance = (Account balance + Unrealised PNL).
Index Price: The price of the underlying asset. \n Mark Price: This is the current mark price.
This indicator shows your position in the auto-deleverage queue. If all lights are lit, in the event of a liquidation, your position may be reduced.

1. '3L' means that the price of the underlying transaction pair has increased by 1%, and the net value of the product has increased by 3% 
 2.'3S' means that the price of the underlying transaction pair fell by 1%, and the net value of the product rose by 3% 
 3. The net value is normally adjusted at 0 o'clock every day, and the extreme market will be adjusted in the intraday. 
 4. Every leverage will charge the corresponding management fee on a daily basis 
 5. Users shall pay attention to the net value of the product before trading. There is a risk that the price will approach zero in extreme conditions.Please watch out the risk in investment.

Net Value For Long = Net value at the last adjustment point * [1+ 3 * (Latest spot transaction price-spot last adjustment point price) / spot last adjustment point price * 100%]；\n\n Net Value For Short = Net value at the last adjustment point * [1- 3 * (Latest spot transaction price-spot last adjustment point price) / spot last adjustment point price * 100%]；
It is necessary to agree with

Dear users：\n Thanks for login and use the leverage ETF products and relevant services (hereinafter “Leveraged ETF”) provided by %@ Exchange. Please read the instruction of Leveraged ETF and the following risk tips carefully. If you continue to use the leveraged ETF after reading the content aforesaid, it will be deemed that you agree all the content of the disclaimer, and you are fully aware of the risks of leveraged ETF and are able to bear the losses caused by it.\n
Please click to read the instruction of leveraged ETF:

Risk tips:
 1.Your purchase/selling price shall not derivate too much from the net value, otherwise you will encounter relevant losses.
 2.If you put the order in the opposite direction, there is a risk that the price will approach zero in extreme conditions.
 Exchange hereby remind you that any losses incurred by the risks mentioned above shall be borne by yourself. This disclaimer, together with other agreements, statements, rules, etc. on Exchange, constitutes the entire agreement that users shall be agreed before using the services and products of Exchange.

The trading bonus cannot be withdrawn directly, but the profitable part could.The trading bonus can be used for opening positions, paying trading fees, funding fee and the settlement for closing positions. The trading bonus will be deducted at the end for paying fee or position loss
When the latest price reaches %s, the commission shall be conducted at the market price.
Trigger price and executive price of stop-loss order: must be higher than the forced liquidation price and less than the latest price.
Trigger price and executive price of take-profit order: must be higher than the latest price.
Trigger price and executive price of stop-loss order: must be less than the forced liquidation price and higher than the latest price.
Trigger price and executive price of take-profit order: must be less than the latest price.
Trigger price or executive price below warning price %s may result in stop-loss failure. Do you want to continue?
Trigger price or executive price above warning price %s may result in stop-loss failure. Do you want to continue?
